poem:
Title: "For Served Tories Astir"

Of coin and country they make their nest,
MPs in blue, free of rosette's demand.
Lambs turned lions, in mainland's jest,
Trading their oath for foreign land.

The once faithful shepherds of the island's flock,
Now feast on lobbyist's hire.
Those apolitical winds that once did rock,
Fall silent to the sway of gold's desire.
